item.description: Auto vs Motorcycle - FATALITY; INC#0860; 01:14PM; 22800 W Roscoe Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IoPg84; West Hills; An auto versus motorcycle collision has left one person determined dead on scene (age/gender unknown at this time) and two additional patients with undetermined injuries. Media questions regarding the collision are referred to LAPD Topanga Division Inc# 2166. No further details; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; E106 E305 RA72 T105; CH8; Margaret Stewart

Vehicle into Building; INC#0425; 09:54AM; 5348 N Topanga Canyon Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FOdUx7; Woodland Hills; At 8:46AM the LAFD responded to a reported vehicle into building. A single car went into a wall (off the parking lot) of a veterinary clinic. Three patients were transported - one adult female employee who was inside the building in unknown condition, two additional patients (age/gender unknown) were transported for minor, non-life threatening injuries. LAFD Urban Search and Rescue unit evaluated the structure and did not determine any loss of structural integrity. There was no evacuation required. LA Building and Safety was notified and is the point of contact for official determination of the building status. Any further media inquires regarding the collision are referred to LAPD Inc# 1159 Topanga Division; FS 84; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E305 E84 EM17 RA84 RA903 T105 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1501; 07:27PM; 13838 W Victory Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Imm9SU; #ValleyGlen; First arriving 20 firefighters took just 26 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in one first (lowest occupied) floor unit of a three-story garden style apartment building comprised of 2 occupied floors over parking. One adult female civilian from a neighboring apartment who may have been exposed to smoke, is now being medically evaluated at scene by LAFD Firefighter/Paramedics. Precautionary transport likely. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 BC14 CM42 E239 E288 E289 E39 E60 E81 E89 EM14 RA60 RA88 T39 T88 T89; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1501; 07:01PM; 13838 W Victory Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Imm9SU; #ValleyGlen; Three story garden-style apartment building (2 occupied floors over parking) with fire in one unit on the first (lowest) occupied floor; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 BC14 CM42 E239 E288 E289 E39 E60 E81 E89 EM14 RA88 T39 T88 T89; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0837; 12:44PM; 1227 N Ozeta Te; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tDuhKx; #HollywoodHills West; Gardener in mid-size pickup truck reportedly lost control of vehicle, which abruptly descended a hillside to travel above and have rear of truck land upon eaves of neighbor's detached garage, with front on truck on wrought iron fence. No injury. Wires downed by incident are communications (e.g. telephone / television) lines, and not power lines. Vehicle recovery will be coordinated by owner and/or law enforcement. Media Inquiries: LAPD West Traffic Division (Incident #2213); FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E227 E41 EM5 RA97 T27 UR88; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1706; 11:29PM; 2814 S Abbot Kinney Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KrUxgL; #Venice; 34 firefighters took 20 minutes (11:49 PM) to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in one unit of a one-story strip mall. No injury. Fire cause under active investigation; FS 63; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; AR1 BC4 E263 E292 E62 E63 E67 RA63 T63 T92; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Agency Assist; INC#1331; 10:14PM; 746 E Commercial St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GMlA4f; #Downtown; LAFD worked for nearly four hours alongside law enforcement, rail and utility officials in a coordinated effort to stabilize the *still ongoing situation* involving one adult male who refuses to come down from a tall electrical transmission tower in an industrial area. Though LAPD Officers will continue to interact with the man, they have released all LAFD resources. Media Inquiries: LAPD Central Division (Incident #3592), LA DWP, Metrolink and Amtrak.; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E202 E203 E27 E290 E4 EM1 H3 HA3 RA2 RA803 T2 T3 T90 UR3; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1411; 07:51PM; 857 S Manhattan Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nzwK4M; #Koreatown; 51 firefighters took just 26 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire on the 2nd floor of a vacant and boarded two-story home. No injury. Fire cause under investigation; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 4; BC11 BC18 CM22 E13 E211 E215 E226 E229 E233 E26 E29 EM11 RA26 RA829 T11 T15 T26 T29 T33; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1411; 07:25PM; 857 S Manhattan Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nzwK4M; #Koreatown; PRELIM: 2 story vacant and boarded home with fire on the 2nd floor; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 4; BC11 E13 E211 E29 LF26 LF29 RA26 RA929 T11; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#1331; 06:31PM; 800 E Jackson St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GJ3eRM; #Downtown; LAFD responding by ground and air to assist law enforcement at a single patient behavioral emergency, where one adult male has climbed a tall electrical transmission tower in an industrial area. No escalating or off-site hazard known. To assure patient and responder safety, all train traffic on the west side of the L.A. River will be stopped until emergency operations are complete. LA DWP is en route. Train Riders: Follow @Metrolink and @PacSurfliners on Twitter ( https://twitter.com/metrolink and https://twitter.com/PacSurfliners ) for any service related information. Media Inquiries: LAPD Central Division (Incident #3592); FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E202 E203 E4 EM1 RA2 T2 T3 UR3; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey
